DataElement.preferredName: Testicular Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Serum Markers Test Result Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group determined from information from the serum tumor markers including Alpha Fetoprotein (AFP), Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (hCG) and Lactate Dehydrogenase (LDH).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004_A laboratory test result identifying markers in a blood sample.  It is used in combination with other measures to determine testicular cancer staging.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Property.preferredName: Testicular Cancer Serum Markers Test Result
Property.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test result identifying markers in a blood sample.  It is used in combination with other measures to determine testicular cancer staging.

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer Serum Markers Test Result
Concepts.definition: A laboratory test result in which markers for testicular cancer are tested in a blood sample for staging purposes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Testicular Enrollment form per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 9/13/13

ValueDomain.preferredName: Testicular Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 7 Serum Markers Test Result Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._A laboratory test result identifying markers in a blood sample.  It is used in combination with other measures to determine testicular cancer staging._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: LDH more than 10 × N or hCG (mIu/ml) more than 50,000 or AFP (ng/ml) more than 10,000. N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay. (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.definition: LDH more than 10 x N or hCG (mIu/ml) more than 50,000 or AFP (ng/ml) more than 10,000. N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay. (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: LDH 1.5-10 × N or hCG (mIu/ml) 5,000-50,000 or AFP (ng/ml) 1,000-10,000. N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay. (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.definition: LDH 1.5-10 x N or hCG (mIu/ml) 5,000-50,000 or AFP (ng/ml) 1,000-10,000. N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay. (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: LDH less than 1.5 × N and hCG (mIu/ml) less than 5,000 and AFP (ng/ml) less than 1,000.  N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay. (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.definition: LDH less than 1.5 x N and hCG (mIu/ml) less than 5,000 and AFP (ng/ml) less than 1,000.  N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay. (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Marker study levels within normal limits. (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.definition: Marker study levels within normal limits. (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Marker studies not available or not performed. (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.definition: Marker studies not available or not performed. (AJCC 7th ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

It is used in combination with other measures to determine testicular cancer staging.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer Serum Markers Test Result
Concepts.definition: A laboratory test result in which markers for testicular cancer are tested in a blood sample for staging purposes.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
